name: Hotel Granvia Hiroshima

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Happy with our one night stay here. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The location is on the train station and you get great views of the Shinkansen coming and going.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

reviews.text: There is no free WIFI that we could find in the hotel which was a shame.
reviews.title: Great location, easy stay - Extremely Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were helpful and friendly. there is also a nice bar on the top floor of the hotel which i would recommend having a drink in.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tram terminus is the other side of the hotel but i would recommend jumping on the tourist bus which stats and stops outside the front doors of the hotel.
reviews.title: Well located and convenient

reviews.text: The place was easy to find from the station, it was super convenient (which was important while traveling with my grandmother), and it was a good price. I think there were some 'upgraded floors', but we didn't reserve or stay on them - hallway smelled a little funny, but i just squirted some of the air freshener into the hall (that was hanging in the closet). The carpet also had a little discoloration in the room, but not such a big deal tot me. I enjoyed my stay, especially for the price!
reviews.title: Great spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the restaurant served good quality food, the room was small and very tired. Despite this, the price was very good and the location perfect for a visit to the Peace Park, which is about 20 minutes on the tram. The hotel is not only next to the train station, but it is next to where the coach leaves for the airport.
reviews.title: Fine for a one night stop-over

reviews.text: Whilst the hotel is not memorable, it is clean and comfortable for a one night stop over. If you stay in the Granvia in Kyoto, do not expect this hotel to be in the same league.
reviews.title: Easy Place To Stay

reviews.text: Arriving late in Hiroshima after a flight from Sapporo to Osaka with a train stopover to visit the Himeji Castle, what a treat to merely walk through the train station to this beautiful hotel. That night we ate at the Steakhouse, enjoying a pricey, but fantastic dinner overlooking the city lights. One of our best meals in Japan.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two rooms. One for us. One for our teenage daughters. Great views. Comfortable beds and pillows. We all slept wonderfully well.
reviews.title: Good location, good amenities = good start to visit the city !

reviews.text: The next morning we gathered breakfast (fresh juice, warm doughnuts) in the train station. The hotel stored our luggage for us while we took the trolley to the Peace Park. Very easy! In the afternoon we picked up our bags & caught a train to Miyajima. Again, so easy!
reviews.title: Outsanding Hotel

reviews.text: The Granvia hotel can be reached from inside the Hiroshima station if you can find your way to it. On the Japanese site of the hotel there is a page that describes the direction clearly, complete with photos.
reviews.title: Older hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a Japan Rail West hotel, and is on the north side of the station. Be aware that the south side and north side of the station, separated by train tracks and platforms, can only be traveled between on foot via an underpass. It is crucial that you take the North exit 北口 (as opposed to 南口 south exit) when you emerge from the station to reach the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Terrific location in center city above Central Train Terminal
reviews.text: The hotel is old fashioned and seems to cater to its Japanese clientele of well-dressed couples and some families. My room with one bed was small, but it has everything except storage spaces. But the service is excellent: good quality towels; thorough cleaning; daily supplies of fresh slippers and robes; Japan Times (English) delivered to the door. Best of all is a superb shower head (a Toto wonder) with tremendous water pressure - a really wonderful treat after a hot day outside.

There are plenty of eateries within and around the station, including a McDonald's and a Danish bakery. The hotel itself has a few restaurants, but they are pricey (20USD for breakfast). The Sheraton hotel and this hotel face each other, and is said to be a newer (but also perhaps more expensive) hotel. One plus of this hotel is that the city's sightseeing loop bus -- which operates during tourist season -- stops right in front of this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfectly located...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hiroshima is less English-friendly than Tokyo and Kyoto, and finding your way around without being able to speak or read Japanese could pose a challenge. I didn't have problem communicating with the people at the front desk of this hotel, as each time someone was able to speak in English, including a helpful concierge/bell captain.
reviews.title: Location, location, location !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When planning my trip to Hiroshima, I struggled with the hotel decision. I was torn between the Hotel Granvia Hiroshima and the Sheraton. I read good and bad reviews about both. I'm SO glad that we chose to stay at Hotel Granvia Hiroshima. It's very convenient to the train station and not difficult to find at all. We stayed on the 17th floor, which boasted nice city views. There are six elevators that are all extremely fast, so we never had issues getting to our room. There are several restaurants at the hotel to choose from. We had breakfast included in our package, so we only dined at the Western style breakfast buffet. There was plenty of variety and the food was good. We visited the hotel bar once. I thought that the drink prices were a little expensive, but if you go during happy hour (5-8pm), drinks are half price! Additionally, the service at the hotel was impeccable! There was always someone willing to help with a smile. We got fabulous restaurant recommendations, directions, train maps, city maps, etc. We asked for room service to send up wine glasses, and they were knocking on our door within 5-10 minutes. We also wanted to order a movie on TV, and someone personally came to ensure that we knew how to purchase the "movie card" and knew what the time limit was (1,000 yen to have the movie channel for 24 hours -- I believe there was a choice of 8-10 movies). After our movie started, we realized that the volume on the TV was stuck and we couldn't hear the movie well. It was almost 10pm, but a maintenance man came straight to our room to fix the TV. We were very impressed!
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: The bedroom and bathroom were rather small (we had a renovated double room). However, it was normal by Japanese standards. There were plenty of toiletries in the bathroom and items in the room to make our stay comfortable (extra pillows, robes, air freshener, tea, coffee, etc). The hotel also provides adapters (however many you want/need) at no extra charge! The bed was firmer than my husband and I like, but that is also normal for a Japanese hotel. There was a strong wifi signal, and we had no issue logging-in on our iPhones and iPad. Best of all, it was FREE!
reviews.title: Hotel Granvia Hiroshima

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at this hotel and highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Convenience & Comfort

reviews.text: Stayed overnight here with 2 teenagers who loved the breakfast. Great spot as so close to the station. Hiroshima castle well worth the visit too only 15 min flat walk from hotel. Very hot when we were there - so being able to sit in hotel foyer air conditioning was wonderful as we waited for Shinkansen back to tokyo. Room clean and had many extras in the bathroom - staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is away from the actual town and points of interest, however it is right at the hub of all the transportation i.e street card and the shinkansen. We like not to be in the city but close enough to be there when we want to. We booked 2 rooms, one of the rooms has recently been furnished, which was nice and tastfully decorated. But another was a bit older but we still get the same amenities. We will stay again.
reviews.title: Good position, average hotel

description: Hotel Granvia Hiroshima in the ideal location directry connected to JR Hiroshima Station.A great deal of sophisticated hospitality welcomes you!Check-in Time 13:00Check-out Time 12:00
